RESPONSE TEXT: Keep a wary eye.

RESPONSE TEXT: See the Hull? That's thanks to the mainlander. A true friend of the Harbor.
DIALOGUE AFTER: TeddyWright: You going to listen to Allen's hate-mongerin'? You even remember who did the Captain's Dance?

RESPONSE TEXT: Everyone hear about Machete Mike? He was found dead. I don't have proof...
But I believe the mainlander may be connected with his death.
DIALOGUE AFTER: TeddyWright: Smalls and Tony, and the others from the dregs. They went to the Lumber Mill.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: UncleKen: What? The mainlander threatened me. Chased me from my home. Allen's a good boy. Listen to him.
RESPONSE TEXT: The mainlander wronged me, reneged on a deal.
Allen may be a handful, but he's always helped us when we needed it most.
DIALOGUE AFTER: TeddyWright: Smalls and Tony, and the others from the dregs. They went to the Lumber Mill.

RESPONSE TEXT: You joining us? Acadia's got to pay.
Murderers gotta pay.
The Hull needs mending. You know, it just don't build itself. I need proper wood, steel, nails. The like.
DIALOGUE AFTER: AllenLee: Nobody asked you to cobble together that stupid wall. You want yourself commodities, you know how to get 'em. Caps.
SCRIPT NOTES: Litany of needs, steely purpose / Irritated

DIALOGUE BEFORE: AllenLee: Nobody asked you to cobble together that stupid wall. You want yourself commodities, you know how to get 'em. Caps.
RESPONSE TEXT: That "stupid wall" is the only thing that kept you stowaways alive. That and the mainlander.
DIALOGUE AFTER: AllenLee: The mainlander? Ha. What kept us safe was Harbormen and the firepower I sold them.
SCRIPT NOTES: Can't believe Allen is that stupid / Angry

DIALOGUE BEFORE: AllenLee: Want supplies? Tell you what... Apply that big ol' brain of yours to dealing with the real threat: those Children of Atom whack-jobs.
RESPONSE TEXT: Haven't you fouled up things enough, Allen? And now you mean to make it worse.
DIALOGUE AFTER: AllenLee: They're still alive aren't they, figure I got a whole lot more work to do.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: AllenLee: They're still alive aren't they, figure I got a whole lot more work to do.
RESPONSE TEXT: No deal. But this isn't the last of it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: AllenLee: Sure the hell looks like it to me.

RESPONSE TEXT: At last...
Uhh...
I ain't goin' down alone.
Filthy mainlander.
Ha! Haha.
No thieves on my dock, dammit.
Leave my docks alone!
You one of those narcoleptics?
Sure, I have all the time in the world.
You ain't big on conversation, are you?
I saw some flashes on the mountain. It weren't lightning, neither.
With that nuclear fallout, the Fog's going to get fierce. Mark my words.
I don't have much love for the Children of Atom. But no one deserves what they got.
This peace with the Children of Atom... Seems a little too good to be true.
DiMA? Maybe Allen's right about mainlanders.
What we did with Avery... *sigh*
Avery worked tirelessly to help all us islanders...
You shut Allen down real good. Hopefully he'll stay shut down.
Well, I'll be. Survived the Captain's Dance. Never thought it'd happen in my lifetime.
Avery... And Acadia both. Gods forgive me, Allen might need to be our next Captain.
I want nothing to do with you.
Look at all we've done to the Harbor. I finally feel safe.
It weren't easy telling Avery about my condition. Glad that's over.
Just need to make it through the day.
Dying's a right bitch. *chuckle*
There's a foul wind coming. Mark my words.
The island's restless. No good can come of it.
If these knuckleheads don't pitch in, the whole lot of us are doomed.
Only sounds that used to be here was the squabbling of gulls and the slapping of the waves.
If the stowaways keep pushing, one day I'll be gone on the high tide. Then where will they be?
*sigh* The Red Death...
You ever heard of... Machete Mike? Hmm.
With proper tools, the things I can do.
It looks like a proper Hull now, don't it? *chuckle*
Nothing more to be done for the Hull.
DiMA and all those synths.... I had no idea.
If the bells sound, Allen, I need you to pass out guns to any Harborman that'll carry them.
SCRIPT NOTES: This argument has been had before, but that makes her only more irritated about it / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: The Hull needs to be fully manned.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Generic: I'm happy to give any man or woman a gun, for caps. I don't do charity.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Generic: I'm happy to give any man or woman a gun, for caps. I don't do charity.
RESPONSE TEXT: Get this through your rum-soaked skull: the Hull falls, we die. That simple.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Generic: I've lived on this island my whole life without some rickety wall to protect me.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Generic: I've lived on this island my whole life without some rickety wall to protect me.
RESPONSE TEXT: Why I even bother...

Not like a cad like you would understand. Leave me.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Those tools were worth a fortune. And you were trying to rip me off.
